channel.title: Uncle Blob is on his last legs
channel.description:
http://weeklyworldnews.com/headlines/27585/green-blob-in-space/
A slightly less bullshit filled explanation is below, I just enjoyed reading the first one because they thought it was coming to earth! Of course that can't happen - I'm already here, duh.
http://news.nationalgeographic.co.uk/news/2011/01/110110-glowing-green-blob-hannys-voorwerp-science-space-american-picture/
Kinda weird it spits out stars, I'm interested in the physics behind that.

item.title: Uncle Blob is on his last legs
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

this is the original they just don’t want mass panic

Read full topic

item.title: Uncle Blob is on his last legs
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:5, topic:378440”][quote] about 650 million light-years from Earth.

The new Hubble picture—the sharpest yet taken of the brilliant cloud—shows that gas in a small region of Hanny’s Voorwerp is collapsing and forming stars, the youngest of which are just a couple million years old.[/quote]

How can they see stars before the light has arrived here?[/quote]

I think they see stars, and assume that there are more that are younger.

Read full topic
item.source: Uncle Blob is on his last legs

The new Hubble picture—the sharpest yet taken of the brilliant cloud—shows that gas in a small region of Hanny’s Voorwerp is collapsing and forming stars, the youngest of which are just a couple million years old.

How can they see stars before the light has arrived here?
